17832966.projn:
SS-Juba Rapid Impact Emergency Project
            (Tf055976) -- P099226
17832966.trustfund:
TF058178-SOUTHERN SUDAN PUBLIC WORKS PROGRAM,TF055976-SOUTHERN SUDAN: RAPID IMPACT
            EMERGENCY PROJECT,TF054776-PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FOR
            SOUTH SUDAN MDTF

repnme.cdata!: Sudan - Juba Rapid Impact Emergency Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Juba Rapid Impact
            Emergency Project for Sudan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and
            Grantee performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF) is
            an effective financing vehicle to address changing
            circumstances in a fragile or post conflict state. The MDTF
            accommodated additional donor funds and was able to use
            freed funds for other development priorities and to add
            components to expand the reach of the project (employment
            and small works for hundreds of thousands of additional
            beneficiaries). Appropriate results frameworks and Project
            Development Objectives (PDOs) that match project activities
            are feasible and necessary even in projects in fragile,
            post-conflict countries. There is a tendency for government
            counterparts, when flooded with donors and donor support, to
            become complacent and defer to the donor community, which
            may result in missed opportunities for capacity building.
            Political imperatives may trump best practices in ensuring
            project success. Giving each donor their own role in the
            MDTF may improve participation and therefore effectiveness,
            even if it may not maximize efficiency through a single,
            harmonized governance structure. The end result was that a
            number of important donors peeled off from the MDTF and
            pursued their own programs and far less resource were
            provided to the MDTF- Southern Sudan (SS) than were
            originally pledged.

17952719.trustfund:
TF055976-SOUTHERN SUDAN: RAPID IMPACT
            EMERGENCY PROJECT,TF058178-SOUTHERN SUDAN PUBLIC WORKS PROGRAM

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Juba Rapid Impact Emergency Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Juba
            Rapid Impact Emergency Project is to put in place critical
            government infrastructure at national and state level; and
            provide basic pharmaceutical stocks and learning materials
            to bridge the emergency situation. The closing date of the
            project will be extended from June 30, 2012 to December 31,
            2012. This will be the fourth extension of the project, and
            the cumulative extension for this project will be four years
            and nine months. The extension is necessary to allow
            completion of the South Sudan Anti -Corruption Commission
            (SSACC) building and full expenditure of Multi-Donor Trust
            Fund for South Sudan (MDTF-SS) resources for the SSAC
            building by December 31, 2012. Further, it will help to
            compensate for the delay in procurement of a supervising
            firm for the design, tendering and construction works; and
            recruitment of contractors for the two buildings.

16351984.trustfund:
TF058178-SOUTHERN SUDAN PUBLIC WORKS PROGRAM,TF055976-SOUTHERN SUDAN: RAPID IMPACT
            EMERGENCY PROJECT,TF054776-PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FOR
            SOUTH SUDAN MDTF

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Juba Rapid Impact Emergency Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Juba
            Rapid Impact Emergency Project is to restore livelihoods
            resulting from the long term civil unrest; restore basic
            services to the affected population; jump start the recovery
            process in Southern Sudan through the emergency provision of
            goods and services to improve government functionality. This
            is a level one restructuring which includes the revision of
            the project development objective (PDO), and the results
            framework; and extension of the closing date from June 30,
            2011 to June 30, 2012.  The extension is necessary to make
            up for the initial loss of time while waiting to obtain
            proof from Southern Sudan Anti - Corruption Commission
            (SSACC) of documentation for its allocated land. Further,
            recruitment of a firm for design, tendering and construction
            supervising was delayed. The project extension is to
            facilitate completion of one component of the project
            (component F) at a cost of US$7.5 million. This will be the
            third extension of the project, and the cumulative extension
            for this project will be 51 months.
